sub_service.s_details: Blood group O has no antigens, but both anti-A and anti-B antibodies in the plasma.
sub_service.sub_details: 38% of the population has O positive blood, making it the most common blood type.

sub_service.s_details: A+ blood contains both A and Rh antigens.Anti-B antibodies in the plasma.
sub_service.sub_details: Around 30% of donors have A positive blood, making it the second most common blood type after O positive (36%).

sub_service.s_details: Blood group AB has both A and B antigens, but no antibodies.
sub_service.sub_details: 6% of the population has AB positive blood, making it the least blood type.

sub_service.s_details: Blood group B has B antigens with anti-A antibodies in the plasma.
sub_service.sub_details: About 9% of the population have B positive blood. B positive red blood cells can be given to both B positive and AB positive patients.

sub_service.s_details: Donor can come our center for donating blood or from home also possible
